TopicTitle: Monoliths, how do you find them?

Articles.Content:
So for the last two hours I have been trying to do a very thorough search for the different Munoliths located on Mun. I started by going through all of the major craters found on the moon

and landing on them and taking Jeb out on a stroll in his cart while Bob and Bill get ready for the return trip.

This has not worked. Its starting to get to the point where I am getting a little frustrated. I figured that squad my put the Monoliths next to easily identifiable landmarks (aka the craters) so that it wouldn't be to hard to find them. I am starting to think that is not the case.

My question to you is, am I doing it right? Are the monoliths in easy to find places but I haven't been thorough enough? Are they in random little places? (IE. the Swaths of White with no identifiable landmarks on the moon) Furthermore, how have you guys found them? Should I use ISA Mapsat? The Muon detector?

I look forward to the communities imput.

On mun there are only 2 munoliths. One is on southpole, and very, very, very hard to find. I would say its impossible without MapSat plugin. The other one it near equator, and it is in the middle of crater indeed! :Its not very big, just like a standard lander. And it is exactly in the middle of crater, on top of little hill:)

Good luck finding it old way:)

At least, as of v0.16, there's actually a third Monolith near the north pole on the Mun. But yeah, the Monoliths are only a few meters high. You are exceeedingly unlikely to find any of the monoliths on the Mun without some sort of plugin-based addon helping you. I could see finding two of the five Kerbin monoliths without being told or using a plugin, but the other three... Yeah, really unlikely.

I just hovered over the crater at 10km and did a visual scan to see if I could find it. I am glad that the munoliths aren't in random places, that is very comforting because I hope to find all of the artifacts in the Kerbol system without use of the Muon detector or the Mapsat plugin.

10km is MUCH too far away to see a monolith. They're hard to spot from 1-2kms away even if you know where to look. They don't do that sparkly thing from a distance like the arches. I've been playing the game constantly for 4 months now, and I've still only found 3 monoliths, two of them with partial help of some spoliers I couldn't avoid.

It is pretty much impossible to stumble upon them by chance.

You can only see them from 1 or 2 km as a shimmering pixel and the surface area of the Mun is 500000kmÃ‚Â². The chance of finding one without using a mapsat are infinitesimal.
